text: More people have walked on the moon than have been to the deepest part of the ocean.
The ocean is so unexplored that we have better maps of Mars than of our own sea floor.
Giant squid have the largest eyes in the animal kingdom — the size of dinner plates — to detect bioluminescent predators in the dark.
There's a type of shrimp called the 'peacock mantis shrimp' that punches with the force of a .22 caliber bullet.
Deep sea fish have antifreeze proteins in their blood that prevent ice crystals from forming.
The giant Pacific octopus has three hearts, nine brains (one central, eight in each arm), and blue blood.
Bioluminescence in the ocean is so common that at depth, most animals glow or can see glowing organisms.
The 'immortal jellyfish' can revert its cells back to childhood, theoretically living forever.
Whales create bubble nets to trap fish — a hunting technique that's passed down through generations.
The pistol shrimp's snap creates a bubble that reaches 4,700°C briefly — hotter than the sun's surface.
Deep sea anglerfish males are so small they fuse permanently into the female's body, sharing blood and becoming a parasitic sperm source.
Coral reefs cover less than 1% of the ocean floor but support about 25% of all marine species.
The Mariana Trench is so deep that if you dropped a steel ball into it, it would take over an hour to reach the bottom.
Underwater lakes and rivers exist at the bottom of the ocean, formed from super-salty brine that's denser than seawater.
Blue whales are so loud that they can communicate with each other across entire ocean basins.
The ocean absorbs about 30% of the CO2 we produce, making it increasingly acidic and threatening marine life.
Hydrothermal vents were only discovered in 1977 and host ecosystems that don't depend on sunlight at all.
Vampire squid live in the 'oxygen minimum zone' where almost no other animals can survive.
The ocean contains more historic artifacts than all the world's museums combined.
Greenland sharks can live over 400 years but don't reach sexual maturity until around 150 years old.
A cubefish is perfectly cubic and poisonous, but in Japan it's considered a delicacy.
The deep ocean is so dark that some fish have evolved transparent bodies to be invisible.
Dolphins can 'see' inside other dolphins' bodies using echolocation — they can detect pregnancy.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth — it can be seen from space.
Hagfish produce so much slime when attacked that they can suffocate predators with it.
Starfish don't have brains or blood — they use seawater to pump nutrients through their bodies.
Seahorses are the only animals where males give birth.
Electric eels can produce 860 volts — enough to stun a horse — and can leap out of water to attack.
The ocean produces over 50% of the world's oxygen through phytoplankton photosynthesis.
Sperm whales sleep vertically, bobbing at the surface in groups.
Sea cucumbers can liquefy their bodies to squeeze through tiny gaps and expel their organs as a defense.
The ocean's deepest fish ever recorded was found at 8,178 meters in the Mariana Trench.
Dolphins can hear frequencies 10 times higher than adult humans can detect.
Giant tube worms near hydrothermal vents grow over 6 feet long and have no mouth, stomach, or gut.
The blue whale's heart is so large that a small child could crawl through its main arteries.
Cuttlefish can change color and texture in milliseconds and can display different patterns on each side of their body.
The mimic octopus can impersonate at least 15 different species including lionfish and sea snakes.
Sharks have been around longer than trees — they've existed for over 400 million years.
Ocean pressure at the deepest point is 1,086 bars — like having 50 jumbo jets stacked on you.
Barnacles have the largest penis-to-body ratio of any animal — up to 8 times their body length.
Parrotfish poop out sand — most of the white sand on tropical beaches is actually parrotfish feces.
The tongue of a blue whale weighs as much as an elephant.
Mantis shrimp can see polarized light and have 16 color receptors compared to our 3.
Orcas are dolphin's, not whales, and they've never killed a human in the wild.
Clownfish are all born male — the dominant fish becomes female and leads the group.
The box jellyfish has 24 eyes, yet has no brain to process what it sees.
Whales evolved from land mammals — they still have tiny leg bones inside their bodies.
The sailfish is the fastest fish in the ocean at 68 mph — faster than a cheetah runs.
Some deep-sea fish can survive pressures that would crush a submarine.
The ocean is 12,100 feet deep on average but some fish have been found at over 26,000 feet.
